Class GameSession

java.lang.Object
UI.session.GameSession
public final class GameSession extends Object
Represents a single playable game session for the UI layer.

GameSession wraps a BoardAdapter and adds session-level state: whose turn it is, whether the game is over, and how many moves have been made. It also provides convenience methods to apply moves from either a human player (with optional Pie Rule handling) or non-human sources (AI, replay, etc.).

Responsibilities

  • Maintain the current player turn (Player)
  • Track move count to support rules that depend on turn number (e.g., Pie Rule)
  • Prevent moves after the game ends
  • Delegate all board mutations and win detection to BoardAdapter

Pie Rule

When applying a human move via applyHumanMove(int, int), this session checks whether the Pie Rule is available using Rules.pieRuleAvailable(int, Player). If available and the clicked cell contains the opponent's stone, the move is treated as a swap-style action: the cell is undone and then replayed for the current player.

All win detection is based on BoardAdapter.isGameOver() and BoardAdapter.getWinner().

  • Field Details

    • adapter

      private final BoardAdapter adapter
      Adapter that exposes the underlying board/game-state operations needed by the UI. This is the single source of truth for board contents and game-over detection.

    • currentPlayer

      private Player currentPlayer
      The player whose turn it currently is. Defaults to Player.RED.

    • gameOver

      private boolean gameOver
      Whether the game session has ended. Once true, moves are rejected.

    • moveCount

      private int moveCount
      Number of moves applied so far in this session. Used for rule checks such as Pie Rule availability.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameSession

      public GameSession(BoardAdapter adapter)
      Creates a new GameSession around the provided board adapter.
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter used to read/update the board state
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if adapter is null

  • Method Details

    • getAdapter

      public BoardAdapter getAdapter()
      Returns the board adapter backing this session.
      Returns:
      the session's BoardAdapter

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      the current player

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns whether the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, otherwise false

    • getMoveCount

      public int getMoveCount()
      Returns the number of moves applied so far.
      Returns:
      the move count

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Returns the winner as reported by the adapter.

      If the game is not over, this may return null or a sentinel value depending on the BoardAdapter implementation.

      Returns:
      the winning Player, or adapter-defined value if no winner yet

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this session back to an initial state.

      This delegates to BoardAdapter.reset() and also resets the session-level state: current player becomes Player.RED, gameOver becomes false, and move count is set to 0.

    • applyHumanMove

      public boolean applyHumanMove(int row, int col)
      Applies a move initiated by a human player.

      This method allows Pie Rule swap behavior (if available) in addition to normal placement rules. If the move is successful, the move count is incremented and the turn advances (or the game ends).

      Parameters:
      row - the board row index
      col - the board column index
      Returns:
      true if the move was applied, otherwise false

    • applyMove

      public boolean applyMove(int row, int col)
      Applies a move without any Pie Rule swap behavior.

      This is suitable for AI moves, scripted moves, or any context where a swap action should not be possible. If the move is successful, the move count is incremented and the turn advances (or the game ends).

      Parameters:
      row - the board row index
      col - the board column index
      Returns:
      true if the move was applied, otherwise false

    • applyMoveInternal

      private boolean applyMoveInternal(int row, int col, boolean allowPieRuleSwap)
      Internal move application method shared by human and non-human move calls.

      Order of operations:

      1. Reject if gameOver is true
      2. If Pie Rule swap is allowed and available, check for swap click
      3. Otherwise attempt a normal move via BoardAdapter.makeMove(int, int, Player)
      4. On success: increment moveCount and advance turn or end game
      Parameters:
      row - the board row index
      col - the board column index
      allowPieRuleSwap - whether Pie Rule swap logic is enabled for this call
      Returns:
      true if the move was applied, otherwise false

    • advanceTurnOrEnd

      private void advanceTurnOrEnd()
      Advances the game to the next state after a successful move.

      If the adapter reports game over, gameOver is set to true and the current player is not changed. Otherwise, turn alternates to the opponent via Player.other().
